category.name: Financial
category.definition: Payment information, such as form of payment, payment card number, or bank account number. If an app uses a payment service (like Stripe, Shopify, or Paypal), and is not collected, it does not need to be disclosed in a privacy policy. You should read the privacy policy of whatever payment service a given app or website is using to understand how they collect and protect your data as well. This category can also contain your credit score, salary, income, assets, debts, or any other financial information.
category.benefits: Online shopping service remembering your card information, or a subscription service that is billed every month. When a company is collecting credit information, they can use this to help track your credit score and give you recommendations based on that.
category.consequences: Stolen credit card information, phishing attacks, or identity theft. This is one of the most sought-after types of data in a data breach, and is certainly the most lucrative when it is stolen. This type of data collection can lead to a lot of stress that is out of your control once it is breached.
